query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Tant’ eran li occhi miei fissi e attenti 2 a disbramarsi la decenne sete, 3 che li altri sensi m’eran tutti spenti.
query.error: **English:** 1 So fixed and intent were my eyes 2 on satisfying my thirst of ten years, 3 that all my other senses were extinguished.
query.result: 1 Kemmys o fis ha tenn o'm dewlyn 2 war owth fulli'm syth a dhegves bledhen, 3 pub sens arall o'm beuys o spenys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Ed essi quinci e quindi avien parete 5 di non caler—così lo santo riso 6 a sé traéli con l’antica rete!—;
query.error: **English:** 4 And on this side and that they came as a wall 5 of indifference—so the holy laughter 6 draws them to itself with the ancient net!—
query.result: 4 Ha hys owth ena ha th'y gila 5 a-dhiworth pub tu—ke'th rydh an kas ris 6 owth tynna orth gans an hen ros!—

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 quando per forza mi fu vòlto il viso 8 ver’ la sinistra mia da quelle dee, 9 perch’ io udi’ da loro un «Troppo fiso!»;
query.error: **English:** 7 when by force my face was turned 8 toward my left by those goddesses, 9 because I heard from them a “Too intent!”;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 e la disposizion ch’a veder èe 11 ne li occhi pur testé dal sol percossi, 12 sanza la vista alquanto esser mi fée.
query.error: **English:** 10 and the disposition that is to be seen 11 in the eyes just now struck by the sun, 12 makes me somewhat lose my sight.
query.result: 10 ha'n fordh owth gweles y'n golwg ow, 11 yn ow dewlyn nowydh gans an howlgh towlek, 12 owth gorra'm gweles rag termyn byghanek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Ma poi ch’al poco il viso riformossi 14 (e dico ‘al poco’ per rispetto al molto 15 sensibile onde a forza mi rimossi),
query.error: **English:** 13 But after a short while his face was restored 14 (and I say ‘a short while’ in comparison to the long 15 time that I was forced to turn away),
query.result: 13 Mes wosa dhe’n byghan an fas a wra furvys 14 (ha my a lever ‘an byghan’ rag an moy 15 sensibla ow a’m gorra dhe omdhrehevel),

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 vidi ’n sul braccio destro esser rivolto 17 lo glorïoso essercito, e tornarsi 18 col sole e con le sette fiamme al volto.
query.error: **English:** 16 I saw the glorious host wheeling on my right arm, 17 and returning with the sun and the seven flames in their faces.
query.result: 16 Yth gweles war’n brassa dhe dhehoo 17 an lu a vri, ha’n drohevel 18 gans an howl ha’n seyth flamm yn aga fasow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Come sotto li scudi per salvarsi 20 volgesi schiera, e sé gira col segno, 21 prima che possa tutta in sé mutarsi;
query.error: **English:** 19 As beneath their shields to save themselves 20 a squadron turns, and wheels with its standard, 21 before it can change its formation entirely;
query.result: 19 Vel ytho y'n dan skoedh rag salva, 20 a wra dhe skwadron, ha'y wra dhe baner, 21 kyns ylli hy hyllji hy forma oll.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 quella milizia del celeste regno 23 che procedeva, tutta trapassonne 24 pria che piegasse il carro il primo legno.
query.error: **English:** 22 that soldiery of the celestial kingdom 23 which was advancing, passed through them all 24 before the chariot of the first rank could swerve.
query.result: 22 An milita ma 'gan an rywvaneth nef, 23 o perthi, a dreus drethon oll, 24 kyns ylli karros an kynsa renk drehevel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Indi a le rote si tornar le donne, 26 e ’l grifon mosse il benedetto carco 27 sì, che però nulla penna crollonne.
query.error: **English:** 25 Then to the wheels the Ladies turned again, 26 and the Griffin moved the blessed burden 27 so that not a single feather trembled.
query.result: 25 Wosa henna dhe'n gwelyow an Benenes, 26 ha'n Griffin a wayas an karga bennak, 27 marnas na wayas unn plu dhe golli.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 La bella donna che mi trasse al varco 29 e Stazio e io seguitavam la rota 30 che fé l’orbita sua con minore arco.
query.error: **English:** 28 The lovely lady who had brought me to the ford, 29 and Statius and I followed the wheel 30 that made its orbit with a smaller arc.
query.result: 28 An venen vrassa a'm gorra dhe'n fordh, 29 ha Statius ha my a sewya an roda, 30 a wrug y'n hwel dre un ark moyha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Sì passeggiando l’alta selva vòta, 32 colpa di quella ch’al serpente crese, 33 temprava i passi un’angelica nota.
query.error: **English:** 31 Thus, walking, we circled the lofty forest, 32 the fault of her who trusted the serpent, 33 an angelic melody tempered our steps.
query.result: 31 Vel ytho, ow tostya an woos ughella, 32 an peth a wrug an hini a gresas an sarf, 33 unn nota a'n jel a dhemedha an passow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Forse in tre voli tanto spazio prese 35 disfrenata saetta, quanto eramo 36 rimossi, quando Bëatrice scese.
query.error: **English:** 34 Perhaps in three flights an arrow unleashed 35 covered as much space as we had moved 36 when Beatrice descended.
query.result: 34 Marnas yn teyr hwegh a gemeras an spas, 35 unn saeth di-frena, pan omov, 36 pan a ziskennas Beatrice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Io senti’ mormorare a tutti «Adamo»; 38 poi cerchiaro una pianta dispogliata 39 di foglie e d’altra fronda in ciascun ramo.
query.error: **English:** 37 I heard everyone murmur “Adam”; 38 then they circled a tree stripped 39 of leaves and every other adornment on each branch.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 La coma sua, che tanto si dilata 41 più quanto più è sù, fora da l’Indi 42 ne’ boschi lor per altezza ammirata.
query.error: **English:** 40 Its crown, which spreads out all the more 41 the higher it is, would be admired in India’s 42 forests for its height.
query.result: 40 Y'n komm, ow tyv dhe leski moyha 41 moy ages ytho dhe ughella, a via 42 owth admirys yn boskyow Eynda rag y'n ughella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 «Beato se’, grifon, che non discindi 44 col becco d’esto legno dolce al gusto, 45 poscia che mal si torce il ventre quindi».
query.error: **English:** 43 “Blessed are you, griffin, that do not descend 44 with your beak to this wood sweet to the taste, 45 since the belly is twisted badly there.”
query.result: 43 “Gwyn vy, grifon, na dhyworth discendya 44 gans bys ow colon magh owth blasa da, 45 wosa mal torrir an koweth ena.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Così dintorno a l’albero robusto 47 gridaron li altri; e l’animal binato: 48 «Sì si conserva il seme d’ogne giusto».
query.error: **English:** 46 Thus around the sturdy tree 47 the others cried out; and the two-formed beast: 48 “Thus is preserved the seed of every just man.”
query.result: 46 Vel ytho, a-dro dhe'n prenn kresek, 47 an erelsi a leveris; ha'n best binas: 48 “Vel ytho an hadher a'n oll just a wra gwithys.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 E vòlto al temo ch’elli avea tirato, 50 trasselo al piè de la vedova frasca, 51 e quel di lei a lei lasciò legato.
query.error: **English:** 49 And turning to the pole that he had drawn, 50 he dragged it to the foot of the widowed stump, 51 and left it bound to her, part of her.
query.result: 49 Ha'n tro dhe'n tem a via tenna tenys, 50 ev a dhrehas dhe dreus an prenn benow, 51 ha'n prenna dhe'n prenna ev a dhegas kevrennek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Come le nostre piante, quando casca 53 giù la gran luce mischiata con quella 54 che raggia dietro a la celeste lasca,
query.error: **English:** 52 Like our plants, when the great light falls 53 down mixed with that 54 which radiates behind the celestial slab,
query.result: 52 Kepar agan plansow, pan vo gwaya 53 an golon meur meskys gans henna 54 a wragh a-dre dhe'n lestrys nevek,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 turgide fansi, e poi si rinovella 56 di suo color ciascuna, pria che ’l sole 57 giunga li suoi corsier sotto altra stella;
query.error: **English:** 55 become turgid and then each one is renewed 56 in its color, before the sun 57 brings its steeds under another star;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 men che di rose e più che di vïole 59 colore aprendo, s’innovò la pianta, 60 che prima avea le ramora sì sole.
query.error: **English:** 58 less than roses and more than violets 59 in color, the plant was renewed, 60 which before had its branches so bare.
query.result: 58 le ages vysi ha moy ages e rosow 59 yn liw, an plans a wra onanvys, 60 a veu y'n geffrys y'n skynnys kyns henna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Io non lo ’ntesi, né qui non si canta 62 l’inno che quella gente allor cantaro, 63 né la nota soffersi tutta quanta.
query.error: **English:** 61 I did not understand it, nor is the hymn sung here 62 that those people sang then, 63 nor did I endure the entire melody.
query.result: 61 Vy ny wodhevis, na ena ny kaner 62 an kan a gana an dus owthina, 63 na an not a wodhevis oll an gwlas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 S’io potessi ritrar come assonnaro 65 li occhi spietati udendo di Siringa, 66 li occhi a cui pur vegghiar costò sì caro;
query.error: **English:** 64 If I could portray how they slumbered 65 the pitiless eyes, hearing of Syrinx, 66 the eyes for which staying awake cost so dearly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 come pintor che con essempro pinga, 68 disegnerei com’ io m’addormentai; 69 ma qual vuol sia che l’assonnar ben finga.
query.error: **English:** 67 like a painter who paints with a model, 68 I would draw how I fell asleep; 69 but let whoever wants to imagine it well.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Però trascorro a quando mi svegliai, 71 e dico ch’un splendor mi squarciò ’l velo 72 del sonno, e un chiamar: «Surgi: che fai?».
query.error: **English:** 70 Therefore I move on to when I awoke, 71 and I say that a brightness tore the veil 72 of sleep, and a call: "Rise: what are you doing?".
query.result: 70 Mes ow tremena bys dhe'n eur vyth sevel, 71 ha vyth leverel golon a dharava 72 an gwlan a'n kows, ha galow: "Surg: pyth wra?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Quali a veder de’ fioretti del melo 74 che del suo pome li angeli fa ghiotti 75 e perpetüe nozze fa nel cielo,
query.error: **English:** 73 Like seeing the little flowers of the apple tree 74 whose fruit makes the angels greedy 75 and makes perpetual weddings in heaven,
query.result: 73 Kepar gweles bleujyow an aval aval, 74 a wra y fruthev bys dhe'n ejellow, 75 ha gwruthylla perpes dhe'n nev,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Pietro e Giovanni e Iacopo condotti 77 e vinti, ritornaro a la parola 78 da la qual furon maggior sonni rotti,
query.error: **English:** 76 Peter and John and James, led 77 and overcome, returned to the word 78 by which greater slumbers were broken,
query.result: 76 Peder ha Jowan ha Jekob a veu 77 ha'gas veghys, dhe'n ger a'n ger, 78 orth an ger a veu moy kows torros,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 e videro scemata loro scuola 80 così di Moïsè come d’Elia, 81 e al maestro suo cangiata stola;
query.error: **English:** 79 and they saw their school diminished 80 both of Moses and of Elijah, 81 and their master's robe changed;
query.result: 79 ha gweles aga skol dynerghys 80 kepar Moyses ha Eli, 81 ha'n mester aga kot kemmys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 tal torna’ io, e vidi quella pia 83 sovra me starsi che conducitrice 84 fu de’ miei passi lungo ’l fiume pria.
query.error: **English:** 82 thus I returned, and I saw that pious one 83 standing over me, who was the guide 84 of my steps along the river before.
query.result: 82 Henwys vyth pyth, ha vyth gweles henna pia 83 ow sevel warnan vy, henna a veu 84 ow thasselma vyth passow a-hedh an avon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 E tutto in dubbio dissi: «Ov’ è Beatrice?». 86 Ond’ ella: «Vedi lei sotto la fronda 87 nova sedere in su la sua radice.
query.error: **English:** 85 And all in doubt I said: "Where is Beatrice?". 86 And she: "See her sitting under the foliage, 87 new, at the foot of its root.
query.result: 85 Ha oll yn ammeth vyth leveris: "Ple'th yw Beatrice?". 86 Ha henna: "Gweles hynsi a-dre'n frondow, 87 nowydh, ow sedhes war y gwreydh y honan".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Vedi la compagnia che la circonda: 89 li altri dopo ’l grifon sen vanno suso 90 con più dolce canzone e più profonda».
query.error: **English:** 88 See the company that surrounds her: 89 the others, following the griffin, go up 90 with a sweeter and deeper song.
query.result: 88 Gweles an gevreyth a'y keworugh: 89 an erel a wra wosa an grifon dhe'n ughella 90 gans kan moy dowr ha moy downder".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 E se più fu lo suo parlar diffuso, 92 non so, però che già ne li occhi m’era 93 quella ch’ad altro intender m’avea chiuso.
query.error: **English:** 91 And if her speech was more diffuse, 92 I do not know, because already in my eyes was 93 she who had closed me to understanding anything else.
query.result: 91 Ha mar veu y lavar moy a-lemmyn, 92 vyth ny wodhaf, rag o veur yn vy golgow 93 henna a veu owth klowsa vy dhe wodhaf neppyth aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Sola sedeasi in su la terra vera, 95 come guardia lasciata lì del plaustro 96 che legar vidi a la biforme fera.
query.error: **English:** 94 Alone she sat upon the true earth, 95 like a guard left there of the chariot 96 that I saw the two-formed beast harnessed to.
query.result: 94 Onan hi a sethas war an nor gwir, 95 kepar gwitha leel ow kensa ena 96 a welas vyth owth kowl dhe'n best dhewfurv.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 In cerchio le facevan di sé claustro 98 le sette ninfe, con quei lumi in mano 99 che son sicuri d’Aquilone e d’Austro.
query.error: **English:** 97 In a circle the seven nymphs made a cloister around her, 98 with those lights in their hands 99 that are safe from the North Wind and the South Wind.
query.result: 97 Yn kelgh yn-dro dhodho aga klawster, 98 an seyth nymph, gans henna golow yn aga dhew, 99 a syw seyr a'n Gwynsav ha'n Hav.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 «Qui sarai tu poco tempo silvano; 101 e sarai meco sanza fine cive 102 di quella Roma onde Cristo è romano.
query.error: **English:** 100 "Here you will be a dweller in the woods for a short time; 101 and you will be a citizen with me without end 102 of that Rome where Christ is a Roman."
query.result: 100 "Ama vyth vyth fylgh yn-mes an kov, 101 ha vyth genef vyth heb termen kyvri 102 a'ga Roma le mayth Krist yw Roman."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Però, in pro del mondo che mal vive, 104 al carro tieni or li occhi, e quel che vedi, 105 ritornato di là, fa che tu scrive».
query.error: **English:** 103 Therefore, for the good of the world that lives badly, 104 keep your eyes on the chariot now, and what you see, 105 when you return from there, make sure you write down."
query.result: 103 Mes, rag an bys ma yw bewnans, 104 gwith an kar kas orth dha lyga, ha'n tra a wel, 105 pan wrello diworth, mar skrif orth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Così Beatrice; e io, che tutto ai piedi 107 d’i suoi comandamenti era divoto, 108 la mente e li occhi ov’ ella volle diedi.
query.error: **English:** 106 Thus Beatrice; and I, who was devoted at the feet 107 of her commands, 108 turned my mind and eyes where she wished.
query.result: 106 Velheth Beatriks; ha my, a veu oll orth traes 107 y'gan ommandmansow, veu devos, 108 an men hag an lyga le mayth hi a vynnas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Non scese mai con sì veloce moto 110 foco di spessa nube, quando piove 111 da quel confine che più va remoto,
query.error: **English:** 109 Never did fire descend with such swift motion 110 from a thick cloud, when it rains 111 from that boundary which is most remote,
query.result: 109 Nyns diskennas bythkan gans ken poes mor splan 110 a-dhyworth kov tewl, pan wra glaw, 111 a'n termen na moyha pella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 com’ io vidi calar l’uccel di Giove 113 per l’alber giù, rompendo de la scorza, 114 non che d’i fiori e de le foglie nove;
query.error: **English:** 112 as I saw the bird of Jove descend 113 down through the tree, breaking through the bark, 114 not just of the flowers and the new leaves;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 e ferì ’l carro di tutta sua forza; 116 ond’ el piegò come nave in fortuna, 117 vinta da l’onda, or da poggia, or da orza.
query.error: **English:** 115 and it struck the chariot with all its force; 116 whereupon it swayed like a ship in a storm, 117 overcome by the waves, now from the stern, now from the bow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Poscia vidi avventarsi ne la cuna 119 del trïunfal veiculo una volpe 120 che d’ogne pasto buon parea digiuna;
query.error: **English:** 118 Then I saw a fox hurl itself into the cradle 119 of the triumphal chariot, 120 which seemed to be fasting from every good food;
query.result: 118 Wosa henna gweles moyha golvan dheudhi 119 orth y'n kres an kar tryumfal, 120 hag a veu ythovel digiwn a bub boos da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 ma, riprendendo lei di laide colpe, 122 la donna mia la volse in tanta futa 123 quanto sofferser l’ossa sanza polpe.
query.error: **English:** 121 but, rebuking it for its ugly sins, 122 my lady put it to flight 123 as fast as its bones, without flesh, could carry it.
query.result: 121 Mes, ow tisplegya hi rag an fethow gwella, 122 an vor a'm wrug hy dheudhi yn ken poes mor 123 ha'n eskern, heb kigow, a alla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Poscia per indi ond’ era pria venuta, 125 l’aguglia vidi scender giù ne l’arca 126 del carro e lasciar lei di sé pennuta;
query.error: **English:** 124 Then, by the way it had come before, 125 I saw the eagle descend down into the body 126 of the chariot and leave it feathered with its own feathers;
query.result: 124 Wosa henna, a-dhyworth an fordh le mayth dos, 125 gweles an er a-dyskynna dheudhi orth an ark 126 a'n kar ha'y hedha hi pluvek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 e qual esce di cuor che si rammarca, 128 tal voce uscì del cielo e cotal disse: 129 «O navicella mia, com’ mal se’ carca!».
query.error: **English:** 127 and as a voice comes from a heart that is grieving, 128 such a voice came from heaven and said: 129 "O my little ship, how badly you are laden!"
query.result: 127 Ha vel ythovel a galon owth a-dhyworth poen, 128 lefel a sown a-dhyworth an nef ha leverel: 129 "O'm bagas byghan, pyth es mor berrys!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Poi parve a me che la terra s’aprisse 131 tr’ambo le ruote, e vidi uscirne un drago 132 che per lo carro sù la coda fisse;
query.error: **English:** 130 Then it seemed to me that the earth opened up 131 between the two wheels, and I saw a dragon come out 132 that fixed its tail on top of the chariot;
query.result: 130 Wosa henna, teves orth y'm bos an norvys 131 ynter an dhew golvan, ha gweles moyha dragon 132 ow fija y lost orth an kar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 e come vespa che ritragge l’ago, 134 a sé traendo la coda maligna, 135 trasse del fondo, e gissen vago vago.
query.error: **English:** 133 and like a wasp that withdraws its sting, 134 drawing its evil tail back to itself, 135 it dragged itself out from the abyss, and went wandering here and there.
query.result: 133 Ha vel ythovel gwesenn ow tynna y golvan, 134 ow tynna y lost drog dheudhi, 135 y tynnas a-dhyworth an downder, ha mos dheudhi a-hwel dheudhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Quel che rimase, come da gramigna 137 vivace terra, da la piuma, offerta 138 forse con intenzion sana e benigna,
query.error: **English:** 136 What remained, like couch grass 137 from fertile soil, from the feathers, offered 138 perhaps with good and kind intentions,
query.result: 136 An peth a veu remenans, vel ythovel gemmyn 137 a-dhyworth tir ow fetha, ow tos orth 138 marow gans menow da ha da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 si ricoperse, e funne ricoperta 140 e l’una e l’altra rota e ’l temo, in tanto 141 che più tiene un sospir la bocca aperta.
query.error: **English:** 139 covered itself up, and both 140 wheels and the pole were covered, in so much time 141 as a sigh keeps the mouth open.
query.result: 139 Y kovras dheudhi, ha kovras veu 140 an dhew golvan ha'n tem, yn ken poes termyn 141 ha'n dowr a wra gesya an genow dheudhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Trasformato così ’l dificio santo 143 mise fuor teste per le parti sue, 144 tre sovra ’l temo e una in ciascun canto.
query.error: **English:** 142 Thus transformed, the holy structure 143 put forth heads from its various parts, 144 three above the pole and one at each corner.
query.result: 142 Wosa henna, an savla sansel veu chanjys, 143 y'gan rannansow y'gan y rannow, 144 tri orth an tem ha unn y'n pub penn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Le prime eran cornute come bue, 146 ma le quattro un sol corno avean per fronte: 147 simile mostro visto ancor non fue.
query.error: **English:** 145 The first were horned like oxen, 146 but the four had a single horn on their foreheads: 147 such a monster had never been seen before.
query.result: 145 An kynsa o veu kernys vel ythovel bugh, 146 mes an peswar o veu unn horn orth aga tal: 147 moster vel ythovel na veu gweles bythkans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
148 Sicura, quasi rocca in alto monte, 149 seder sovresso una puttana sciolta 150 m’apparve con le ciglia intorno pronte;
query.error: **English:** 148 Secure, like a fortress on a high mountain, 149 she sat upon a loose harlot, 150 she appeared to me with her eyes alert all around;
query.result: 148 Sygur, kepar kastel war ughel menydh, 149 eyl hi a-ugh war puttan di-skoll, 150 hi a dhiskwedhas dhym orth y’n golwg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
151 e come perché non li fosse tolta, 152 vidi di costa a lei dritto un gigante; 153 e basciavansi insieme alcuna volta.
query.error: **English:** 151 and as if so that she would not be taken from him, 152 I saw a giant standing beside her; 153 and sometimes they kissed each other.
query.result: 151 Ha kepar rag na vossy hy hyf anedhi, 152 mi a welas ogas dhedhi gewr, 153 ha pub traweyth yth esa y’gan bassya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
154 Ma perché l’occhio cupido e vagante 155 a me rivolse, quel feroce drudo 156 la flagellò dal capo infin le piante;
query.error: **English:** 154 But because her wanton and wandering eye 155 turned toward me, that fierce lover 156 beat her from head to foot;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
157 poi, di sospetto pieno e d’ira crudo, 158 disciolse il mostro, e trassel per la selva, 159 tanto che sol di lei mi fece scudo
query.error: **English:** 157 then, full of suspicion and cruel anger, 158 he untied the monster and dragged it through the forest, 159 so that he made me a shield from her alone
query.result: 157 Wosa, leun a dowt ha kolonys krys, 158 a dhallethas an alwedh ha'y gorra dre'n koed, 159 bys na wra dhemedhans dhymm dhe'n puttan ha'n alwedh nowydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
160 a la puttana e a la nova belva.
query.error: **English:** 160 to the whore and to the new beast.
query.result: 160 dhe'n whor ha dhe'n best nowydh.
